oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Family Bible of Lucinda Clementine Crocker
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Entry in Bible reads: "James M. Crocker was killed in battle in the Confederate army, in the battle of Frederic[k]sburg Virginia, December 13, 1862." His widow Miriam Guthrie Crocker applied for a pension from Tennessee (W2386). Various family information about James, Miriam, their daughter Lucinda Clementine, and an infant son Cebern Crocker ("died December 18, 1862 aged one month and ten days") is recorded in the Bible. Pvt. J. M. Crocker served in Co. I, 13th S.C. Infantry Regiment, CSA.
